title: 99. Tides - Bethel Music
text:
16 Items Album Review 
The Bethel Church in Redding, California launched the massively successful worship group Jesus Culture, but Bethel Music has more to do with another church project, Bethel Live, whose members Brian and Jenn Johnson, Jeremy Riddle, William Matthews, and Steffany Frizzell-Gretzinger show up here. Big difference is that Bethel Music is a studio project, allowing for more electro tones and synthetic sounds, both of which are in abundance during the worship-dance-pop opener "Chasing You." The title track is a moody interlude, another album-oriented touch you wouldn't get from Bethel Live, but fans of all the above — and for that matter, Hillsong — get plenty of that arena rock worship music the genre was built on, including the key cuts "Breaking Through" (a Riddle number) and "Strong in Us" (a Johnson song). Customer Reviews by FENIXARISING I love this song "chasing you" she sounds amazing and she commands that music with such conviction the production value is so well mastered I love it! Biography Formed: 2009 in Redding, CA Genre: Christian & Gospel Years Active: '00s, '10s Bethel Music isn't a group per se, but a Christian praise & worship collective centered around Bethel Church in Redding, California, and the ministry of Bill Johnson. Part church, part publishing house, part label, and home to singers, groups, musicians, and songwriters like Brian & Jenn Johnson, Jeremy Riddle, Steffany Gretzinger, William Matthews, and many others, Bethel Music releases collections of musical praise & worship gatherings. Highlights include 2012's The Loft Sessions, which was recorded...   Bethel Music 1.
